title: Breaking Down the Israel–Iran Conflict: What We Know So Far
byline: This guide answers the most important questions about the Israel Iran war that is unfolding right now. The United States and Israel have launched major military strikes on Iran and Iran has responded with missile attacks across the region. This is one of the most serious escalations in the Middle East in years.

title: Sri Lanka knock Pakistan out as New Zealand reach semi-finals
byline: New Zealand have qualified for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup semi-finals after Sri Lanka denied Pakistan the massive victory margin they needed in their Super Eights clash in Kandy on Saturday.

title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has been killed, state media says
byline: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has been killed, state media confirms.

title: How Sri Lanka Is Responding to the Israel–Iran Conflict
byline: As tensions escalate between Israel and Iran, Sri Lanka has taken a series of diplomatic, aviation and precautionary measures to manage potential fallout and safeguard its citizens. Here is how Sri Lanka is responding.

title: UAE intercepts 137 ballistic missiles and 209 drones in Iranian attack
byline: The UAE’s air defence systems intercepted and destroyed 137 ballistic missiles and 209 drones launched towards the country since the start of the Iranian attack, the Ministry of Defence said.

title: Daughter and grandchild of Iran’s Khamenei killed in US-Israeli strikes, state media says
byline: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei’s daughter, grandchild, daughter-in-law and son-in-law were killed in U.S.-Israeli strikes

title: Trump claims Iran’s Supreme Leader killed in joint US Israeli strikes
byline: Iran’s Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has been killed in a joint American and Israeli strike, according to US president Donald Trump.

title: Putin says killing of Khamenei is 'cynical' murder
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday condemned the killing of Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei as a ’’cynical’’ murder but he offered little in public to Moscow’s ally beyond condolences.

title: Electricity tariff hike looms amid coal tender dispute: Ravi Karunanayake
byline: Former Finance Minister and Member of Parliament Ravi Karunanayake has charged that the government’s claim that coal was imported through a proper tender procedure for the first time in history is “a complete lie,” warning that the proposed electricity tariff hike will further burden the public.

title: Iran prepared for ‘all scenarios’ including Khamenei’s death: parliament speaker
byline: Iran has prepared for “all scenarios,” including the way forward, after the death of supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei following US and Israeli strikes, its parliament’s speaker said Sunday.

title: At least 10 killed in Karachi clashes during march towards US Consulate after Khamenei strike
byline: Edhi Welfare Organisation’s information wing confirmed that nine people have been killed and several injured near Mai Kolachi Road during the firing and unrest. They were transferred to the Civil Hospital Trauma Center.

title: Mainly dry weather to prevail over most parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department has forecast mainly dry weather conditions across most parts of the island over the next 36 hours.

title: Oil tanker hit off Oman coast after drones strike Duqm port
byline: A Palau-flagged oil tanker was hit off Oman’s Musandam peninsula on Sunday injuring four people, the country’s maritime security centre said, following drone strikes on the Gulf country’s commercial port of Duqm.

title: Public warned of financial fraud using  Industry Ministry name
byline: The Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Ministry has warned the public about a financial fraud being carried out using a fake letterhead of the Ministry.

title: Three days needed to restore fuel supply: Tanker owners
byline: The Sri Lanka Petroleum Private Tanker Owners’ Association (SLPPTOA) says it will take at least three days to recover from the fuel shortage and normalise distribution across the country due to ongoing panic buying.

title: Namal urges calm amid global tensions
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser Namal Rajapaksa has issued a statement highlighting the impact of global conflicts on Sri Lanka, urging preparedness, dialogue, and the protection of citizens both at home and abroad.

title: Colombo air quality turns ‘unhealthy for sensitive groups’
byline: Air quality in Colombo dropped to “unhealthy” levels this afternoon, according to real-time Air Quality Index (AQI) data published by IQAir.

title: QR code may return if fuel hoarding continues: Deputy Minister
byline: The QR code system will be reintroduced only if the public begins hoarding fuel, Deputy Minister of Energy Muhammadu Ilyas Muhammadu Arkam said.

title: Protest demands resignation of Sri Lanka Cricket Board
byline: A protest was held outside the headquarters of Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) yesterday (28), with demonstrators demanding the resignation of the cricket board over the national team’s continued string of poor performances.

title: UAE condemns Iran’s missile attacks, calls for diplomatic solutions
byline: The United Arab Emirates Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MoFA) has strongly condemned what it described as blatant Iranian missile attacks targeting the United Arab Emirates and several brotherly nations in the region, calling the actions a flagrant violation of national sovereignty and international law.

title: Kyiv says Russia accepted US plan for Ukraine security guarantees
byline: Russia said at recent talks in Geneva it would accept the U.S. proposal for Ukraine’s post-war security guarantees, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s chief of staff said on Saturday.

title: Protests erupt in Jammu and Kashmir over killing of Iran Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei
byline: Protests broke out across parts of Jammu and Kashmir after Iran confirmed the death of Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei. Iranian state media reported that the Ayatollah died in the early hours of Saturday during the joint military strikes carried out by Israel and the United States.

title: No fuel shortages; stocks secured until May, says CPC
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) said that there will be no delays in receiving fuel stocks ordered up to April and May, assuring the public that supplies remain stable despite tensions in the Middle East.

title: Over 50 flights cancelled at BIA amid Middle East conflict
byline: A total of 54 flights scheduled to arrive and depart from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have been cancelled due to the ongoing war situation in the Middle East, the Airport Officer-in-Charge said.

title: Etihad Airways suspends Abu Dhabi departures amid Middle East tensions
byline: In an unprecedented disruption to air travel linked to escalating US–Israel military strikes on Iran, Etihad Airways has announced the temporary suspension of all departures from Abu Dhabi’s Zayed International Airport until 2:00 p.m. UAE time on Sunday, March 01, 2026.

title: SriLankan Airlines cancels all Middle East flights amid ongoing tensions
byline: SriLankan Airlines announced that all flights to destinations in the Middle East have been cancelled today due to the prevailing situation in the region.

title: Dubai airport, iconic Burj Al Arab hotel damaged in Iranian missile strikes
byline: Dubai’s international airport and its landmark Burj Al Arab hotel sustained damage as overnight Iranian retaliatory attacks spread across the Gulf states and the wider Middle East, reaching beyond U.S. bases and interests.

title: Iran president, 2 officials to lead transition after Khamenei’s death: state TV
byline: Iranian state media reported on Sunday that a temporary leadership council will oversee the country’s transitional phase following the assassination of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, in accordance with constitutional provisions governing succession.

title: What we know so far: Supreme Leader Khamenei killed, as Iran launches retaliatory strikes
byline: Iran’s state media has confirmed that Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei has been killed, after attacks across Iran by Israel and the US, which began on Saturday morning local time.

title: Assembly of experts to decide successor to Iran’s Supreme Leader
byline: The process of selecting a successor to Iran’s Supreme Leader rests solely with the country’s powerful constitutional body known as the Assembly of Experts, according to Iran’s Constitution.

title: Sri Lanka’s Jayasuriya to step down, Contract runs till June
byline: Sanath Jayasuriya has decided to step down as Sri Lanka’s men’s head coach following the team’s narrow defeat to Pakistan that ended their T20 World Cup campaign.

title: Iran says US and Israel strikes hit school killing 108
byline: At least 108 people have died in an explosion at a school in southern Iran, according to a local prosecutor.

title: Stay vigilant: Sri Lankan government warns one million expats in the Middle East
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said that it is closely monitoring the prevailing security situation in the Middle East, stressing that the safety and well-being of nearly one million Sri Lankan nationals living and working in the region remain the government’s highest priority.

title: UAE intercepts 137 ballistic missiles and 209 drones in Iranian attack
byline: The UAE’s air defence systems intercepted and destroyed 137 ballistic missiles and 209 drones launched towards the country since the start of the Iranian attack, the Ministry of Defence said.
